title: Data for R by Example
text: Data examples exercises book “R Example” (first edition) Jim Albert Maria Rizzo (2012; Springer). install package: First install package “remotes” type Console: remotes::install_github("mariarizzo/Rxdata") use datasets Rxdata installation: library(Rxdata)

title: Baseball Batting History Data — battinghistory

what: Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
title: Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
text: data collected 16th Annual Twins Day Festival Twinsburg, Ohio, August 1991. 495 adult twins interviewed. original study aimed investigate 'much another year schooling likely raise one's income?' Pairs twins provide control confounding factors intelligence, family background, etc.

title: Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
text: 183 obs.  16 variables: DLHRWAGE difference (twin 1 minus twin 2) logarithm hourly wage, given dollars. DEDUC1 difference (twin 1 minus twin 2) self-reported education, given years. AGE Age years twin 1. AGESQ AGE squared. HRWAGEH Hourly wage twin 2. WHITEH 1 twin 2 white, 0 otherwise. MALEH 1 twin 2 male, 0 otherwise. EDUCH Self-reported education (years) twin 2. HRWAGEL Hourly wage twin 1. WHITEL 1 twin 1 white, 0 otherwise. MALEL 1 twin 1 male, 0 otherwise. EDUCL Self-reported education (years) twin 1. DEDUC2 difference (twin 1 minus twin 2) cross-reported education. DTEN difference (twin 1 minus twin 2) tenure, number years current job. DMARRIED difference (twin 1 minus twin 2) marital status, 1 signifies "married" 0 signifies "unmarried". DUNCOV difference (twin 1 minus twin 2) union coverage, 1 signifies "covered" 0 "uncovered".

title: Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
text: Guido Imbens, PhD. UCLA, Department Economics.

title: Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
text: 183 cases; 147 complete cases. Twin 1's cross-reported education number years schooling completed twin 1 reported twin 2. data analysis, logarithm hourly wage typically used instead hourly wage.

title: Twins Income and Education Levels Data — twins
text: Ashenfelter, Orley Krueger, Alan.  "Estimates Economic Return Schooling New Sample Twins."  American Economic Review 84.5 (Dec. 1994) 1157-1173.
